spec.name: Edmond Brion
spec.bio: French architect known for his contributions to Moroccan architecture during the early 20th century.

timeline.title: Graduated from École des Beaux-Arts
timeline.description: Graduated as a DPLG architect from the École Nationale et Spéciale des Beaux-Arts in Paris.

timeline.title: Moved to Morocco
timeline.description: Arrived in Morocco and began his practice, associating with Auguste Cadet.

timeline.title: Collaboration on Habous Quarter
timeline.description: Collaborated with Auguste Cadet on the design and construction of the Habous Quarter in Casablanca (period between 1918-1949).

timeline.title: Founded Moroccan Chapter of SADG
timeline.description: Founded the Moroccan chapter of SADG (Société des architectes diplômés par le gouvernement).

timeline.title: Designed Tasso Building
timeline.description: Designed the Tasso Building in Casablanca.

timeline.title: Designed Bendahan Building
timeline.description: Designed the Bendahan Building in Casablanca.

timeline.title: Designed State Bank of Morocco (Casablanca branch)
timeline.description: Designed the Casablanca branch of the State Bank of Morocco.

timeline.title: Designed Cité Ouvrière Indigène
timeline.description: Designed the 'cité ouvrière indigène' for the Compagnie Sucriere Marocaine (COSUMA).

links.title: Les architectes du Quartier des Habous de Casablanca (French)
